00076 /**
00077  * \addtogroup Shape
00078  * \brief Information about Shapes.
00079  * 
00080  * \description
00081  * 
00082  *   Information about Shapes (shapes of meshes etc). These may have
00083  *   a topological flavor to them, but since they arent heirarchical
00084  *   (e.g., children-parent), they are being located here rather
00085  *   than \ref TopologyRelations. This is meant to work in conjunction with 
00086  *   \ref ElemDeath e.g., given some information about the shape
00087  *   of a mesh is there some information about a dead element region
00088  *   that would be of interest, such as the region cutting through the shape ? 
00089  */
00090 
00091 
00092 /**
00093  * \ingroup Shape
00094  * \defgroup PrivateShape (Private)
00095  */

00098 /** 
00099  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00100  * \brief inits the sfi array
00101  *
00102  * \description
00103  * 
00104  *  inits the sfi array
00105  *
00106  * \modifications
00107  *   - 06/07/06 ACG created
00108  */
00109 FC_ReturnCode _fc_initSFI_Array(
00110   _FC_SFI_ARRAY *sfi /**< input - sorted face info array */
00111   ){
00112   sfi->numVals = 0;
00113   sfi->maxVals = 0;
00114   sfi->vals = NULL;
00115   
00116   return FC_SUCCESS;
00117 }
00118 
00119 /** 
00120  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00121  * \brief add an sfi to the sfi array
00122  *
00123  * \description
00124  * 
00125  *  adds an sfi to the sfi array.
00126  *  returns 1 if it added it,
00127  *  0 if there is one already there.
00128  *
00129  * \modifications
00130  *   - 06/07/06 ACG created
00131  */
00132 int _fc_addToSFI_Array(
00133   _FC_SFI_ARRAY *sfi,
00134   _FC_FACEINFO *fi
00135 ){
00136   int low, high, mid;
00137   int indexx;
00138   _FC_FACEINFO **temp;
00139 
00140 
00141   if (sfi->vals == NULL){ //empty
00142     sfi->vals = (_FC_FACEINFO**)malloc(sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO*));
00143     if (sfi->vals == NULL){
00144       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00145       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00146     }
00147     sfi->numVals = 1;
00148     sfi->maxVals = 1;
00149     sfi->vals[0] = fi; //gets the ptr, now responsible for the memory
00150     return 1;
00151   }
00152   
00153   //binary search
00154   low = 0;
00155   high = sfi->numVals-1;
00156   while(low <= high){
00157     mid = (low+high)/2;
00158     //      printf("low %d high %d mid %d\n",low,high,mid);
00159     if ((sfi->vals[mid])->faceID == fi->faceID){
00160       return 0;
00161     } else if ((sfi->vals[mid])->faceID < fi->faceID){
00162       low = mid+1;
00163     } else{
00164       high = mid -1;
00165     }
00166   }
00167 
00168   //either goes below or above mid. realloc if necessary
00169   indexx = ((sfi->vals[mid])->faceID > fi->faceID ? mid:mid+1);
00170   if (sfi->numVals >= sfi->maxVals){ //grow
00171     temp = (_FC_FACEINFO**)realloc(sfi->vals,(2*sfi->maxVals)*sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO*));
00172     if (temp == NULL){
00173       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00174       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00175     }
00176     sfi->maxVals*=2;
00177     sfi->vals = temp;
00178   }
00179   //memcpy didnt work right when i moved more than 1 element up
00180   memmove((sfi->vals)+indexx+1,(sfi->vals)+indexx,
00181        (sfi->numVals-indexx)*sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO*));
00182   sfi->vals[indexx] = fi; //gets the ptr, now responsible for the memory
00183   sfi->numVals++;
00184   return 1;
00185   
00186 }
00187 
00188 /** 
00189  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00190  * \brief looks for a fi index in sfi array
00191  *
00192  * \description
00193  * 
00194  *  looks for a fi index in sfi array. returns a pointer to the item
00195  *  if its there, NULL if not
00196  *
00197  * \modifications
00198  *   - 06/07/06 ACG created
00199  */
00200 FC_ReturnCode _fc_lookupInSFI_Array(
00201   _FC_SFI_ARRAY *sfi,
00202   int i,
00203   _FC_FACEINFO** fi
00204 ){
00205 
00206   int low, high, mid;
00207 
00208   *fi = NULL;
00209 
00210   if (sfi->vals == NULL){ //empty
00211     return FC_SUCCESS;
00212   }
00213 
00214   //binary search
00215   
00216   low = 0;
00217   high = sfi->numVals-1;
00218   while(low <= high){
00219     mid = (low+high)/2;
00220     //      printf("low %d high %d mid %d\n",low,high,mid);
00221     if ((sfi->vals[mid])->faceID == i){
00222       *fi = sfi->vals[mid];
00223       return FC_SUCCESS;
00224     } else if ((sfi->vals[mid])->faceID < i){
00225       low = mid+1;
00226     } else{
00227       high = mid -1;
00228     }
00229   }
00230 
00231   return FC_SUCCESS;
00232 }
00233 
00234 /** 
00235  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00236  * \brief removes an item from the sfi array
00237  *
00238  * \description
00239  * 
00240  *  removes an item from the sfi array. returns a pointer to it.
00241  *  the user is responsible for freeing it when he is done with it
00242  *
00243  * \modifications
00244  *   - 06/07/06 ACG created
00245  */
00246 FC_ReturnCode _fc_removeFromSFI_Array(
00247   _FC_SFI_ARRAY *sfi,
00248   int i,
00249    _FC_FACEINFO** fi
00250 ){
00251   int low, high, mid;
00252 
00253   *fi = NULL;
00254 
00255   if (sfi->vals == NULL){ //empty
00256     return FC_SUCCESS;
00257   }
00258 
00259   //binary search
00260   
00261   low = 0;
00262   high = sfi->numVals-1;
00263   while(low <= high){
00264     mid = (low+high)/2;
00265     //      printf("low %d high %d mid %d\n",low,high,mid);
00266     if ((sfi->vals[mid])->faceID == i){
00267       *fi = sfi->vals[mid];
00268       //shuffle everything down
00269       memmove((sfi->vals)+mid,(sfi->vals)+mid+1,
00270            (sfi->numVals-mid)*sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO*));
00271       sfi->numVals--;
00272       return FC_SUCCESS;
00273     } else if ((sfi->vals[mid])->faceID < i){
00274       low = mid+1;
00275     } else{
00276       high = mid -1;
00277     }
00278   }
00279 
00280   return FC_SUCCESS;
00281 }
00282 
00283 /** 
00284  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00285  * \brief reallocs the sfi array
00286  *
00287  * \description
00288  * 
00289  *  reallocs the sfi array
00290  *
00291  * \modifications
00292  *   - 06/07/06 ACG created
00293  */
00294 int _fc_reallocSFI_Array(
00295  _FC_SFI_ARRAY *sfi
00296  ){
00297   _FC_FACEINFO **temp = (_FC_FACEINFO**)realloc(sfi->vals,
00298                                (sfi->numVals)*sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO*));
00299   if (temp == NULL){
00300     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00301     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00302   }
00303   sfi->maxVals = sfi->numVals;
00304   sfi->vals = temp;
00305 
00306   return 1;
00307 }
00308 
00309 /** 
00310  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00311  * \brief prints the sfi array
00312  *
00313  * \description
00314  * 
00315  *  prints the sfi array
00316  *
00317  * \modifications
00318  *   - 06/07/06 ACG created
00319  */
00320 void _fc_printSFI_Array(
00321   _FC_SFI_ARRAY *sfi
00322 ){
00323   int i;
00324   printf("SFI_Array has %d vals\n",sfi->numVals);
00325   for (i = 0; i < sfi->numVals; i++){
00326     printf("faceid %d elemid %d normal %10g %10g %10g\n",
00327         (sfi->vals[i])->faceID,
00328         (sfi->vals[i])->elemID,
00329         (sfi->vals[i])->normal[0],
00330         (sfi->vals[i])->normal[1],
00331         (sfi->vals[i])->normal[2]);
00332   }
00333 }

00336 /** 
00337  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00338  * \brief frees the sfi array
00339  *
00340  * \description
00341  * 
00342  *  frees the sfi array
00343  *
00344  * \modifications
00345  *   - 06/07/06 ACG created
00346  */
00347 void _fc_freeSFI_Array(
00348   _FC_SFI_ARRAY *sfi
00349  ){
00350   int i;
00351   for(i = 0; i < sfi->numVals; i++){
00352     //free each face info
00353     _FC_FACEINFO *fi = sfi->vals[i];
00354     free(fi);
00355   }
00356   //free the array if it isnt already
00357   if (sfi->vals) free(sfi->vals);
00358   sfi->vals = NULL;
00359   sfi->numVals = 0;
00360   sfi->maxVals = 0;
00361 }

00364 /** 
00365  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00366  * \brief return sorted array of ptrs to faceinfos for the subset skin
00367  *
00368  * \description 
00369  *
00370  *    This is a variation of fc_getSubsetSkin that also returns
00371  *    the element and the normal giving rise to those faces. Its
00372  *    easier to get these all at the same time.
00373  *
00374  *    There seems to be an issue in skin on how to handle an empty subset.
00375  *    Here I will return empty subset as an error.
00376  *
00377  *    Note: Since this is based on skin, in theory it handles
00378  *    not just element-faces but other topodim as well. In those
00379  *    cases I don't think there is a guarentee that the face-equivalent
00380  *    item is unique in the set.
00381  *
00382  *    This is a helper for the revised _fc_getSubsetShapes. It is
00383  *    a combination of the old 
00384  *    _fc_makeSubsetSkinFaceListWithElementData and the
00385  *    the old _fc_makeFaceListWithNormalsData. This was 
00386  *    then renamed from getDetailedSkinData
00387  *
00388  * \todo
00389  *   - replaced the linked list with a numFace allocated array to
00390  *     simulate a hash table to speed things up. will want a real hash table
00391  *
00392  * \modifications 
00393  *   - 06/02/06 ACG created from the elem data and the normal data
00394  *                  to increase efficiency of sides.
00395  *   - 06/05/06 ACG trying replacing the linked list with a numFace allocated
00396  *                  array to simulate a hash table to speed things up.
00397  *   - 06/07/06 ACG replacing the skinlist with a sorted array of
00398  *                  _FC_FACEINFO since it will need to search 
00399  *                  it later
00400  *   - 08/19/06 ACG renamed from getDetailedSkinData.
00401  */
00402 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildFaceInfoListFromSubset(
00403    FC_Subset subset, /**< input - subset */
00404    _FC_SFI_ARRAY *skinlist /**< output - sorted array of faceinfos */
00405   ){
00406 
00407   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00408   int i, j;
00409   FC_AssociationType assoc_orig, assoc_skin;
00410   int numMember, *memberIDs, maxNumSkin, *counts, numChild, *childIDs;
00411   int topodim_orig;
00412   FC_Mesh mesh;
00413   FC_ElementType elemType;
00414 
00415   int *temp_hasharray; //this wil be replaced by a real hashtable later
00416 
00417 
00418   //---default return values
00419   //  if (skinlist)
00420   //    *skinlist = NULL;
00421 
00422   // check input
00423   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) ||
00424       !skinlist) {
00425     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00426     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00427   }
00428 
00429   // log message
00430   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating faceinfo list");
00431 
00432   // Get info from subset and a little more checking
00433   rc = fc_getSubsetNumMember(subset, &numMember);
00434   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00435     return rc;
00436 
00437   if (numMember < 1) {
00438     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't create skin of empty subset");
00439     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00440   }
00441 
00442   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, NULL, NULL, &assoc_orig); 
00443   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00444     return rc;
00445 
00446 
00447   if (!(assoc_orig == FC_AT_ELEMENT || assoc_orig == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH)){
00448     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't handle subset with association type %s",
00449                           fc_getAssociationTypeText(assoc_orig));
00450     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00451   }
00452 
00453   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
00454   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00455     return rc;
00456 
00457   // determine topodim of the members
00458   rc = fc_getMeshEntityElementType(mesh, assoc_orig, 0, &elemType);
00459   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00460     free(memberIDs);
00461     return rc;
00462   }
00463   topodim_orig = fc_getElementTypeTopoDim(elemType);
00464 
00465   if (topodim_orig != 3){
00466     fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid topodim %d (must be 3)\n",topodim_orig);
00467     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00468   }
00469   assoc_skin = FC_AT_FACE;
00470 
00471   // Get members -- If subset is whole, get all elements
00472   if (assoc_orig == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) {
00473     assoc_orig = FC_AT_ELEMENT;
00474     rc = fc_getMeshNumElement(mesh, &numMember);
00475     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00476       return rc;
00477 
00478     memberIDs = malloc(numMember*sizeof(int));
00479     if (!memberIDs) {
00480       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00481       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00482     }
00483     for (i = 0; i < numMember; i++)
00484       memberIDs[i] = i;
00485   }
00486   else {
00487     rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMember, &memberIDs);
00488     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00489       return rc;
00490   }
00491 
00492   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, assoc_skin, &maxNumSkin);
00493   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00494     free(memberIDs);
00495     return rc;
00496   }
00497   counts = calloc(maxNumSkin, sizeof(int));
00498   if (!counts) {
00499     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00500     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00501   }
00502 
00503   //adding all the faces for each element with the element id as the data.
00504   //if a face arises again from a different element, then remove it
00505   temp_hasharray = (int*)malloc(maxNumSkin*sizeof(int));
00506   if (temp_hasharray == NULL){
00507     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00508     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00509   }
00510   for (i = 0; i < maxNumSkin; i++){
00511     temp_hasharray[i] = -1;
00512   }
00513   
00514   //  printf("determining the skin faces and elems\n");
00515   for (i = 0; i < numMember; i++) {
00516     fc_getMeshEntityChildren(mesh, assoc_orig, memberIDs[i], assoc_skin,
00517                     &numChild, &childIDs);
00518     for (j = 0; j < numChild; j++){
00519       switch(++counts[childIDs[j]]){
00520       case 1:{ //add it
00521      temp_hasharray[childIDs[j]] = memberIDs[i];
00522      break;
00523       }
00524       case 2:{ //remove it
00525      temp_hasharray[childIDs[j]] = -1;
00526      break;
00527       }
00528       default:  //its gone already
00529      //      printf("skipping face %d element %d\n",childIDs[j],memberIDs[i]);
00530      break;
00531       }
00532     }
00533     free(childIDs);
00534   }
00535   free(memberIDs);
00536   free(counts);
00537   //  printf("done determining the skin faces and elems\n");
00538 
00539   //  printf("buiding the SFI array and determining the normals\n");
00540   //since its already sorted there is a faster way to add things, but we will
00541   //use the interface for now
00542 
00543   rc = _fc_initSFI_Array(skinlist);
00544   for (i = maxNumSkin-1; i >= 0; i--){
00545     if (temp_hasharray[i] != -1){
00546       int test = 0;
00547       _FC_FACEINFO *face_data = (_FC_FACEINFO*)malloc(sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO));
00548       face_data->faceID = i;
00549       face_data->elemID = temp_hasharray[i];
00550       //      printf("adding face %d element %d\n",face_data->faceID,
00551       //       face_data->elemID);
00552       rc = _fc_getOutwardFaceNormal(mesh, i, temp_hasharray[i],&(face_data->normal));
00553       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00554      return FC_ERROR;
00555       }
00556 
00557       test = _fc_addToSFI_Array(skinlist,face_data);
00558       if (!test){
00559      free(temp_hasharray);
00560      if (face_data) free(face_data);
00561      //skinlist will be freed outside
00562      return rc;
00563       }
00564     }
00565   }
00566   //  printf("done building the skinlist and determining the normals\n");
00567   free(temp_hasharray);
00568 
00569   return FC_SUCCESS;
00570 }
00571 
00572 
00573 /** 
00574  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00575  * \brief given a current shape, return sorted array of ptrs to faceinfos 
00576  *        for the shape sides
00577  *
00578  * \description 
00579  *
00580  *    Similiar to \ref _fc_buildFaceInfoListFromShape, but in that
00581  *    case you have the subset of the entire shape elements,
00582  *    including its innards. This method is instead called
00583  *    when you are going to reshape, and therefore have only
00584  *    the information about the sides.
00585  *
00586  * \todo
00587  *   - will this work ?
00588  *   - untested
00589  *
00590  * \modifications 
00591  *   - 08/19/06 ACG created
00592  */
00593 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildFaceInfoListFromShape(
00594   FC_Shape* shape, /**< input -shape */
00595    _FC_SFI_ARRAY *skinlist /**< output - sorted array of faceinfos */
00596   ){
00597 
00598   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00599   FC_Mesh mesh;
00600   int i,k;
00601   
00602   if (!shape || shape->numSides < 1){
00603     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00604   }
00605 
00606 
00607   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(shape->faces[0],&mesh);
00608   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00609     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get mesh from subset");
00610     return rc;
00611   }
00612 
00613   rc = _fc_initSFI_Array(skinlist);
00614   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00615     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't init SFI array");
00616     return rc;
00617   }
00618 
00619   //each face can only be a child of one element making up the sides
00620   for (i = 0; i < shape->numSides; i++){
00621     int *farr, *earr, numf, nume;
00622     FC_SortedIntArray facearr;
00623     FC_SortedIntArray elemarr;
00624 
00625     rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(shape->faces[i],&numf,&farr);
00626     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00627       fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get face members");
00628       _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00629       return rc;
00630     }
00631 
00632     rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(shape->elems[i],&nume,&earr);
00633     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00634       fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get elem members");
00635       free(farr);
00636       _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00637       return rc;
00638     }
00639 
00640     rc = fc_convertIntArrayToSortedIntArray(numf,farr,1,&facearr);
00641     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00642       fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't convert face array");
00643       free(farr);
00644       free(earr);
00645       _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00646       return rc;
00647     }
00648 
00649     rc = fc_convertIntArrayToSortedIntArray(nume,earr,1,&elemarr);
00650     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00651       fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't convert elem array");
00652       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&facearr);
00653       free(earr);
00654       _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00655       return rc;
00656     }
00657 
00658     while(elemarr.numVal){
00659       int curre;
00660       int numChild, *childIDs;
00661       rc = fc_getSortedIntArrayBack(&elemarr,&curre);
00662       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00663      fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get last elem");
00664      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&facearr);
00665      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&elemarr);
00666      _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00667      return rc;
00668       }
00669 
00670       rc = fc_getMeshEntityChildren(mesh,FC_AT_ELEMENT,curre,
00671                         FC_AT_FACE,&numChild,&childIDs);
00672       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00673      fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get elem children");
00674      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&facearr);
00675      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&elemarr);
00676      _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00677      return rc;
00678       }
00679 
00680       for (k = 0; k < numChild;k++){
00681      int ret;
00682      if (fc_deleteIntFromSortedIntArray(&facearr,childIDs[k])){
00683        _FC_FACEINFO *face_data = (_FC_FACEINFO*)malloc(sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO));
00684        face_data->faceID = childIDs[k];
00685        face_data->elemID = curre;
00686        rc = _fc_getOutwardFaceNormal(mesh, face_data->faceID,
00687                          face_data->elemID,
00688                          &(face_data->normal));
00689        if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00690          fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get normal for this face");
00691          fc_freeSortedIntArray(&facearr);
00692          fc_freeSortedIntArray(&elemarr);
00693          _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00694          return FC_ERROR;
00695        }
00696 
00697        ret = _fc_addToSFI_Array(skinlist,face_data);
00698        if (!ret){
00699          fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't add to SFI array");
00700          fc_freeSortedIntArray(&facearr);
00701          fc_freeSortedIntArray(&elemarr);
00702          _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00703          if (face_data) free(face_data);
00704          return FC_ERROR;
00705        }
00706      }
00707       }//loop over children of this element
00708       free(childIDs);
00709       fc_popSortedIntArrayBack(&elemarr);
00710     } //loop over elements of this side
00711 
00712     //now all the faces and elems should have been moved to the skinlist
00713     if (facearr.numVal && elemarr.numVal){
00714       fc_printfErrorMessage("there are still remaining faces or elems for this side");
00715       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&facearr);
00716       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&elemarr);
00717       _fc_freeSFI_Array(skinlist);
00718       return FC_ERROR;
00719     }
00720 
00721     fc_freeSortedIntArray(&facearr);
00722     fc_freeSortedIntArray(&elemarr);
00723 
00724   }//loop over sides
00725 
00726   return FC_SUCCESS;
00727 }
00728 
00729 /** 
00730  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00731  * \brief Returns outward normal vector for a given face on a given element 
00732  *
00733  * \description 
00734  *
00735  *  Returns outward normal vector for a given face on a given element 
00736  *  Uses assumption of fc_calcSurfaceNormals that this is only
00737  *  correct for planar elements (like triangles
00738  *  and planar quads), but checking FaceType rather than ElemType.
00739  *
00740  * \todo
00741  *   - faster search
00742  *   - check mem allocation, esp in inner _fc_calcSurfaceNormal
00743  *   - does this need to be explicitly unittested? it is tested inso
00744  *     far as getSubsetSides and getPlanarSideNormal have been tested
00745  *
00746  * \modifications 
00747  *   - 10/07/05 ACG created
00748  *   - 12/19/2005 ACG moved from \ref TopologyRelations to \ref Shape
00749  */
00750 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getOutwardFaceNormal(
00751   FC_Mesh mesh,        /**< input - mesh */
00752   int faceID,          /**< input - faceID */                                  
00753   int elemID,          /**< input - elemID */                                  
00754   FC_Vector* normal    /**< output - normal vector */
00755 ) {
00756   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00757   FC_ElementType elemType, *faceTypes;
00758   FC_Coords coords[4]; //restricted to tri and quad
00759   FC_Vector temp_normal;
00760   int numelem, numface, orient, numDim, numFacePerElem;
00761   int i,j,k;
00762   double* mesh_coords;
00763   int maxNumVertPerFace, *numVertPerFace, *faceConns, *elemToFaceConns;
00764   int *elemFaceOrients;
00765 
00766   //default
00767   if (normal){
00768     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++){
00769       (*normal)[i] = 0;
00770     }
00771   }
00772 
00773   fc_printfLogMessage("calc normal for face %d on elem %d\n", faceID, elemID);
00774 
00775   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !normal){
00776     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00777     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00778   }
00779 
00780   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, NULL, &numelem, &elemType);
00781   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00782     return rc;
00783 
00784   rc = fc_getMeshNumFace(mesh,&numface);
00785   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00786     return rc;
00787 
00788   numFacePerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumFace(elemType);
00789 
00790   if (elemID < 0 || elemID > numelem || faceID < 0 || faceID > numface){
00791     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00792     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00793   }
00794 
00795   rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &numVertPerFace, &maxNumVertPerFace, 
00796                               &faceConns);
00797   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00798     return rc;
00799   rc = fc_getMeshFaceTypesPtr(mesh, &faceTypes);
00800   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00801     return rc;
00802 
00803   if (faceTypes[faceID] != FC_ET_TRI && faceTypes[faceID] != FC_ET_QUAD){
00804     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s, can't handle face type %s",
00805                           fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR),
00806                           fc_getElementTypeText(faceTypes[faceID]));
00807    return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00808   }
00809 
00810   rc = fc_getMeshElementToFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &elemToFaceConns);
00811   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00812     return rc;
00813   rc = fc_getMeshElementFaceOrientsPtr(mesh, &elemFaceOrients);
00814   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00815     return rc;
00816   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &mesh_coords);
00817   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
00818     return rc;
00819 
00820   orient = 0;
00821   for (i = 0; i < numFacePerElem; i++){
00822     if (elemToFaceConns[elemID*numFacePerElem+i] == faceID){
00823       orient = elemFaceOrients[elemID*numFacePerElem+i];
00824       break;
00825     }
00826   }
00827   if (orient == 0){
00828     fc_printfErrorMessage("face %d not in face list for element %d",
00829                           faceID,elemID);
00830     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00831   }
00832   
00833   for (j = 0; j < numVertPerFace[faceID]; j++) {
00834     for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++)
00835      coords[j][k] = mesh_coords[faceConns[faceID*maxNumVertPerFace+j]*numDim+k];
00836     for (k = numDim; k < 3; k++)
00837       coords[j][k] = 0;
00838   }
00839 
00840   _fc_calcSurfaceNormal(numVertPerFace[faceID], coords, &temp_normal);
00841   //  printf("surface normal (%g %g %g) ",
00842   //     temp_normal[0],temp_normal[1], temp_normal[2]);
00843 
00844   //  normal = (FC_Vector*)malloc(sizeof(FC_Vector));
00845   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00846     (*normal)[i] = orient*temp_normal[i];
00847 
00848   //  printf(" after orient (%g %g %g)\n",(*normal)[0],(*normal)[1],
00849   //     (*normal)[2]);
00850   
00851   return FC_SUCCESS;
00852 }
00853 
00854 
00855 /** 
00856  * \ingroup  PrivateShape
00857  * \brief makes the shape parts from the faceinfolist
00858  *
00859  * \description 
00860  *    makes the shape parts from the faceinfolist. This was the major
00861  *    guts of the old _fc_getSubsetSides (now defunct as a result),
00862  *    but I'm pulling it out in order to be able to do a reangle of
00863  *    an existing shape.
00864  *
00865  * \todo
00866  *   - will need to standardize on devouring the faceinfo list, 
00867  *     in case of input error etc
00868  *   - just writing this now, it isnt tested
00869  *
00870  * \modifications 
00871  *   - 10/04/05 ACG created as surfacesegment. trying to keep this
00872  *                  as close as possible
00873  *                  in algorithm to fc_segment
00874  *   - 11/30/05 ACG changed name from surfaceSegment to getSubsetSides to
00875  *                   reflect new terminology.
00876  *   - 01/13/06 ACG rewrote using new WSK algorithm in \ref fc_segment
00877  *   - 06/06/06 ACG replacing the currlist (built from the working list) with
00878  *                  two growing int arrays which are then handed to
00879  *                  the subsets. this drops out one of the (sorting) 
00880  *                  linked lists.
00881  *   - 06/07/06 ACG replacing the working list (built from the face list) with
00882  *                  a growing unsorted array of _FC_FACEINFO ptrs.
00883  *                  this drops out another sorted linked list.
00884  *   - 06/07/06 ACG replacing the faceinfo list (built from buildFaceInfoList)
00885  *                  with a growing sorted array of _FC_FACEINFO ptrs. this
00886  *                  drops out another sorted linked list. We wont be
00887  *                  adding anything to it, but the search will be faster
00888  *   - 06/16/06 ACG warning about creases
00889  *   - 06/28/06 ACG moved to private
00890  *   - 08/16/06 ACG created from splitting out of _fc_getSubsetSides.
00891  *                  renamed to createShapePartsFromFaceInfoList 
00892  */
00893 FC_ReturnCode _fc_createShapePartsFromFaceInfoList(
00894   FC_Mesh mesh, /**< input -- the mesh */                      
00895   _FC_SFI_ARRAY *in_faceinfolist, /**< input - the starting array
00896                          with all the facedata, if this
00897                          method is successful,  will
00898                          end empty */
00899   char **basename,             /**< input - base name for the sides */
00900   double comp_angle,           /**< input - if two neighboring faces
00901                                 differ by more than this angle then
00902                                 they are considered to be on 
00903                                 different surfaces.*/
00904   int shared_dim,              /**< input - the minimum dimensionality
00905                       of shared part of neighbors of faces */
00906   int *numSides,               /**< output - number of new subsets */
00907   FC_Subset** newFaceSubsets,  /**< output - array of segmented
00908                       regions (by face)*/
00909   FC_Subset** newElemSubsets,  /**< output - array of segmented
00910                       regions (by element)*/
00911   int ***adjmatrix              /**< output - adjmatrix */
00912   ){
00913 
00914   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00915 
00916   char* temp_name;
00917 
00918   _FC_INTPAIR *edgePairs = NULL;
00919   int numEdgePairs = 0;
00920   int maxEdgePairs = 0;
00921   int *sideArray = NULL; //temporary till I get a hash table - edge face ID to side table
00922   int numMeshFace = 0;
00923 
00924   int numSegments; //these are temporary till we set up the new Shape Object
00925   FC_Subset* faceSegments = NULL;
00926   FC_Subset* elemSegments = NULL;
00927 
00928   int **intmatrix = NULL;
00929   int i,j;
00930   
00931   //---default return values
00932   if (numSides)
00933     *numSides = -1;
00934   if (newFaceSubsets)
00935     *newFaceSubsets = NULL;
00936   if (newElemSubsets)
00937     *newElemSubsets = NULL;
00938   if (adjmatrix)
00939     *adjmatrix = NULL;
00940 
00941   
00942   // check input
00943   if (!in_faceinfolist || !numSides ||
00944       shared_dim < 0 || shared_dim > 1  || !adjmatrix ||
00945       !newFaceSubsets || ! newElemSubsets || comp_angle < 0 ||
00946       comp_angle > 180) { 
00947     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00948     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00949   }
00950 
00951   // log message
00952   fc_printfLogMessage("getting shapeinfo from faceinfolist");
00953 
00954   if (in_faceinfolist->numVals == 0){ //return if empty subset
00955     *numSides = 0;
00956     return FC_SUCCESS;
00957   }
00958 
00959   // setup space for names of segments
00960   temp_name = malloc((strlen(*basename)+30)*sizeof(char));
00961   if (temp_name == NULL) {
00962     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00963     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00964   }
00965 
00966   //set up space for edgepairs
00967   edgePairs = (_FC_INTPAIR*)malloc(sizeof(_FC_INTPAIR));
00968   if (edgePairs == NULL){
00969     free(temp_name);
00970     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00971     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00972   }
00973 
00974   numEdgePairs = 0;
00975   maxEdgePairs = 1;
00976   //set up space for sideArray, to be replaced by a hashtable
00977   rc = fc_getMeshNumFace(mesh,&numMeshFace);
00978   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00979     free(temp_name);
00980     return rc;
00981   }
00982 
00983   sideArray = (int*)malloc(numMeshFace*sizeof(int));
00984   if (sideArray == NULL){
00985     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00986     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00987   }
00988   for (i=0 ; i < numMeshFace; i++){
00989     sideArray[i] = -1;
00990   }
00991 
00992   //  printf("segmenting faceinfo list\n");
00993   //---segment the faceinfo list
00994   numSegments = 0;
00995   while(in_faceinfolist->numVals){ // each pass will create a new side
00996     //first set up data structures....
00997 
00998     //info list which will contain members of the current side
00999     //being built. this list needs to be added to, popped off
01000     //either end and order doesnt matter (neither here or later).
01001     //contains info on the face, assoc elem, and normal.
01002     //therefore choosing faceinfo array. allocating space for
01003     //1 since we know there will be at least one in this face
01004     //(that is - the one we pop off the facelist
01005     //directly below)
01006     _FC_FACEINFO** working_list  = (_FC_FACEINFO**)malloc(sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO*));
01007     int numworkinglist = 0;
01008     int maxworkinglist = 1;
01009 
01010     //id arrays for the current side. chose (unsorted) int arrays 
01011     //becuase its the most efficient way to later add the IDs to the
01012     ///2 subsets(faces and elems) - add the whole array at once
01013     //(subset will do a sorting and uniqueness of the array).
01014     //they dont need to be sorted or searched. start by
01015     //allocating space for 1, since we know there wil be at least
01016     //1 side in this face (that is - the one we pop off the facelist
01017     //directly below
01018     int *currside_faces = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)); 
01019     int *currside_elems = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int));
01020                                    
01021     int numcurrsideIDs = 0;
01022     int maxcurrsideIDs = 1;
01023 
01024     if (!working_list || ! currside_faces || ! currside_elems){
01025       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01026       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01027     }
01028 
01029     //     printf("working on side %d\n",numSegments);
01030 
01031     //initialize - pop off the last one and addit to the working list
01032     _FC_FACEINFO *temp_node = in_faceinfolist->vals[in_faceinfolist->numVals-1];
01033     in_faceinfolist->numVals--;
01034     working_list[0]= temp_node; //we know we have space for it
01035     numworkinglist = 1;
01036 
01037     // "grow" connected region from seed by checking neighbors
01038     while(numworkinglist){
01039       int currID;
01040       FC_Vector currNormal; 
01041 
01042       // remove last entity from working list and put it on
01043       // the 3 lists with side info
01044       _FC_FACEINFO *currnode = working_list[numworkinglist-1]; 
01045       numworkinglist--;
01046 
01047       sideArray[currnode->faceID] = numSegments; //fill in its side in the array (hashtable)
01048       if (numcurrsideIDs == maxcurrsideIDs){//grow the lists
01049      int* temp = (int*)realloc(currside_faces,(2*maxcurrsideIDs)*sizeof(int));
01050      if (temp == NULL){
01051        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01052        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01053      }
01054      currside_faces = temp;
01055      temp = (int*)realloc(currside_elems,(2*maxcurrsideIDs)*sizeof(int));
01056      if (temp == NULL){
01057        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01058        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01059      }
01060      currside_elems = temp;
01061      maxcurrsideIDs*=2;
01062       }
01063       currside_faces[numcurrsideIDs] = currnode->faceID;
01064       currside_elems[numcurrsideIDs] = currnode->elemID;
01065       numcurrsideIDs++;
01066       
01067       //we only need these if there is a neighbor, but it
01068       //allows us to free the currnode
01069       currID = currnode->faceID;
01070       for (i = 0; i < 3; i++){
01071      currNormal[i] = currnode->normal[i];
01072       }
01073       free(currnode); //free the actual info, not the ptr.
01074 
01075       if (in_faceinfolist->numVals){ //we have neighbors to check (otherwise
01076      // just loop till empty out working list
01077      int *neighborIDs;
01078      int numNeighbor;
01079 
01080      //   printf("checking neighbors of currid = %d\n",currID);
01081      // Move neighbors of that entity that satisfy the angle criteria
01082      // that are in the orig list to the working list
01083      rc = fc_getMeshEntityNeighbors(mesh, currID, FC_AT_FACE, shared_dim,
01084                            &numNeighbor, &neighborIDs);
01085      if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01086        //clean up
01087        return rc;
01088      
01089      for (i = 0; i < numNeighbor; i++) {
01090        double angle;
01091        _FC_FACEINFO *node;
01092 
01093 
01094        rc = _fc_lookupInSFI_Array(in_faceinfolist,neighborIDs[i],&node);
01095        if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01096          fc_printfErrorMessage("cant check for key in list");
01097          //clean up
01098          return rc;
01099        }
01100        
01101        if (node == NULL){ //this face is not part of the skin
01102          //        printf("face %d in not ont he skin\n",neighborIDs[i]);
01103          continue;
01104        }
01105 
01106        //does this neighbor satisfy the angle criteria ?
01107        rc = fc_calcAngleBetweenVectors(currNormal,
01108                            node->normal,
01109                            &angle);
01110        if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01111          fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get angle between vectors");
01112          //clean up
01113          return rc;
01114        }
01115 
01116        if (angle > comp_angle){ 
01117          //this face is not part of this side, but it is an edgepair
01118          void *temp;
01119          //        printf("face %d in not on the side, but is an edge\n",node->faceID);
01120          if (numEdgePairs + 1 > maxEdgePairs) {
01121            maxEdgePairs *= 2;
01122            temp = realloc(edgePairs, maxEdgePairs*sizeof(_FC_INTPAIR));
01123            if (temp == NULL) {
01124           fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01125           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;  
01126            }
01127            edgePairs = temp;
01128          }
01129          
01130          edgePairs[numEdgePairs].ID1 = currID;
01131          edgePairs[numEdgePairs].ID2 = node->faceID;
01132          numEdgePairs++;
01133          continue;
01134        }
01135        
01136        //its part of the skin and its on this side
01137        //   printf("face %d is on the side\n",node->faceID);
01138        rc = _fc_removeFromSFI_Array(in_faceinfolist,neighborIDs[i],&node);
01139        if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01140          fc_printfErrorMessage("cant remove node");
01141          //clean up
01142          return rc;
01143        }
01144 
01145        //now add that data to the workinglist
01146        if (numworkinglist == maxworkinglist){ //grow the array
01147          _FC_FACEINFO** temp = (_FC_FACEINFO**)realloc(working_list,
01148                                      (2*maxworkinglist)*sizeof(_FC_FACEINFO*));
01149          if (temp == NULL){
01150            fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01151            return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01152          }
01153          working_list = temp;
01154          maxworkinglist*=2;
01155        }
01156        working_list[numworkinglist] = node; //gets the ptr
01157        numworkinglist++;
01158        
01159      } //end for
01160      free(neighborIDs);
01161       } //end if facelist != NULL
01162     } // end while working list
01163     free(working_list); //this is the array itself, there are no members now
01164 
01165     //now weve got faces and elem arrays for this side 
01166     { // create subsets from arrays of IDs
01167       void *temp;
01168 
01169       //      printf("making subsets from arrays\n");
01170       temp = realloc(faceSegments, (numSegments+1)*sizeof(FC_Subset));
01171       if (temp == NULL) {
01172      fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01173      return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01174       }
01175       faceSegments = temp;
01176       sprintf(temp_name, "%s_FaceSurface%d", *basename, numSegments);
01177       rc = fc_createSubset(mesh, temp_name, FC_AT_FACE, &faceSegments[numSegments]);
01178       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01179      fc_printfErrorMessage("cannot create newFaceSubset[%d]", numSegments);
01180      //clean up
01181      return FC_ERROR; 
01182       }
01183 
01184       rc = fc_addArrayMembersToSubset(faceSegments[numSegments], numcurrsideIDs,
01185                           currside_faces);
01186       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01187      fc_printfErrorMessage("cannot add ids to facesegment");
01188      //clean up
01189      return FC_ERROR; 
01190       }
01191       
01192       temp = realloc(elemSegments, (numSegments+1)*sizeof(FC_Subset));
01193       if (temp == NULL) {
01194      fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01195      return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01196       }
01197       elemSegments = temp;
01198       sprintf(temp_name, "%s_ElemSurface%d", *basename, numSegments);
01199       rc = fc_createSubset(mesh, temp_name, FC_AT_ELEMENT, &elemSegments[numSegments]);
01200       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01201      fc_printfErrorMessage("cannot create newElemSubset[%d]", numSegments);
01202      //clean up
01203      return FC_ERROR; 
01204       }
01205 
01206       rc = fc_addArrayMembersToSubset(elemSegments[numSegments], numcurrsideIDs,
01207                           currside_elems);
01208       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01209      fc_printfErrorMessage("cannot add ids to facesegment");
01210      //clean up
01211      return FC_ERROR; 
01212       }
01213 
01214       //clean up currside info
01215       free(currside_faces);
01216       free(currside_elems);
01217 
01218       numSegments++;
01219     } //created subsets
01220   } // while orig_list
01221 
01222   free(in_faceinfolist->vals); //free the array of ptrs, already freed what they are pting to
01223 
01224 
01225   //adjmatrix calculation
01226   intmatrix = (int**)malloc(numSegments*sizeof(int*));
01227   for (i = 0; i < numSegments; i++){
01228     intmatrix[i] = (int*)calloc(numSegments,sizeof(int));
01229   }
01230   //  printf("internal calc of adjmatrix\n");
01231 
01232   for (i = 0; i < numEdgePairs; i++){
01233     //      printf("ID %d side %d ID %d side %d\n",edgePairs[i].ID1,sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID1],
01234     //        edgePairs[i].ID2,sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID2]);
01235     if (sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID1] == sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID2]){
01236       fc_printfWarningMessage("Faces %d %d are edges but both on same side %d - Might be a crease\n",
01237                      edgePairs[i].ID1,edgePairs[i].ID2,sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID1]);
01238     }else{
01239       intmatrix[sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID1]][sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID2]] = 1;
01240       intmatrix[sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID2]][sideArray[edgePairs[i].ID1]] = 1;
01241     }
01242   }
01243 
01244   if (0){
01245     //print adj matrix
01246     printf("before leaving shape parts\n");
01247     for (i = 0; i < numSegments; i++){  
01248       for (j = 0; j < numSegments; j++){     
01249      printf("%d ", intmatrix[i][j]);
01250       }
01251       printf("\n");
01252     }
01253   }
01254 
01255   // cleanup (orig_list is empty)
01256   free(temp_name);
01257   free(sideArray);
01258   free(edgePairs);
01259 
01260   //return values 
01261   *numSides = numSegments;
01262   *newFaceSubsets = faceSegments;
01263   *newElemSubsets = elemSegments;
01264   *adjmatrix = intmatrix;
01265 
01266   return FC_SUCCESS;
01267 }
01268 
01269 
01270 
01271 /** \name Creating General Shapes from Subsets and Meshes */
01272 //----------------------------------------------------------
01273 //@{
01274 
01275 /**
01276  * \ingroup Shape
01277  * \brief given a subset, returns an array of FC_Shapes
01278  *
01279  * \description 
01280  *
01281  *  Given a subset returns an array of FC_Shapes.
01282  *  Vals for comp_angle are limited to 0->180 degrees because
01283  *  of the return val of acos. The choice is tricky because 
01284  *  for curved sides, setting this too low will result in
01285  *  each face along the curve will be considerd a new side, but
01286  *  setting it too high means that some things that should be
01287  *  distinct sides will be combined into one.
01288  *
01289  *  The face and elem subsets will be named as the name of the 
01290  *  original subset, postpended with  "Shape#" followed by
01291  *  "_FaceSurface#" or "_ElemSurface#" where # will be the index into the
01292  *  array of subsets for that shape.
01293  *
01294  *  In a given shape the indicies of the face and elem arrays correspond,
01295  *  that is side 0 consists of the faces in the subset face[0] and the
01296  *  elements in the subset elem[0]. There is no correspondence between
01297  *  the order of the faces and the order of the elems, within a subset,
01298  *  that is the first face in side 0 does not necessarily come from
01299  *  the first elem in side 0. In fact, the subsets may have different
01300  *  lengths e.g, if one element corresponds to more than one face
01301  *  on a side (which can happen depending on the angle chosen).
01302  *
01303  *  Note that pieces that are touching will come out as
01304  *  1 distinct shape with a lot of edges as opposed to
01305  *  two distinct shapes. Segment will do the same thing.
01306  *
01307  *  Fails if NULL subset. Returns 0 shapes if empty subset.
01308  *
01309  *  Notes:
01310  *
01311  *    - this does not use displacements.
01312  *    - vals for comp_angle are limited to 0->180 degrees because
01313  *      of the return val of acos. Similary, if the mesh angle
01314  *      is not in that range, it will return with an error.
01315  *    - becuase of the calculation of the normals, this method is limited
01316  *      to elements of topodim 3 who have faces of type \ref FC_ET_TRI or
01317  *      \ref FC_ET_QUAD
01318  *    - internally, this uses edge info between sides to build the adj
01319  *      matrix. In the case of a crease in the shape, two faces may
01320  *      appear to be on different sides at some point, but later
01321  *      discovered to be on the same side via neighbors that are
01322  *      without a crease between them. I believe this all works out
01323  *      fine, but I dont guarentee it. In the building of the
01324  *      adjacenecy matrix, the user will be warned about pairs
01325  *      of faces like this.
01326  *
01327  * \todo
01328  *  - want a hashtable to do the adjmatrix calc (see innards)
01329  *  - note, this does not clean up memory well in case of weird error
01330  *     (that shouldnt occur) deep within the list building
01331  *
01332  * \modifications
01333  * - 06/04/06 ACG created
01334  * - 08/19/06 ACG _fc_getSubsetSides (created 10/04/05 ACG) merged
01335  *                in now that that facelist processing has been
01336  *                separated out. (see \ref _fc_buildFaceInfoListFromSubset)
01337  * - 09/18/06 ACG better subset names
01338  */
01339 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetShapes(
01340   FC_Subset in_subset,     /**< input - subset */
01341   double comp_angle,       /**< input - if two neighboring faces
01342                                differ by more than this angle then
01343                                they are considered to be on 
01344                                different surfaces.*/
01345   int shared_dim,          /**< input - the minimum dimensionality of shared 
01346                                 part of neighbors of faces */
01347   int *numShapes,          /**< output - number of shapes */
01348   FC_Shape **shapes        /**< output shapes array */
01349 ){
01350 
01351   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01352   FC_Mesh mesh;
01353   FC_AssociationType assoc;
01354 
01355   char *subsetName;
01356   int numMem, junk;
01357 
01358   _FC_SFI_ARRAY faceinfo_list;
01359 
01360   int numSides;              
01361   FC_Subset* newFaceSubsets; 
01362   FC_Subset* newElemSubsets; 
01363   int **adjmatrix;
01364 
01365   int numParts;
01366   int *sidesPerPart;
01367   int **partSideIDS;
01368   FC_Shape *lshapes;
01369   
01370   int i,j,k;
01371 
01372   //defaults
01373   if (numShapes)
01374     *numShapes = -1;
01375   if (shapes)
01376     *shapes = NULL;
01377 
01378   if (!numShapes || !shapes  || !fc_isSubsetValid(in_subset) ||
01379   shared_dim < 0 || shared_dim > 1 || comp_angle < 0 ||
01380   comp_angle > 180){
01381     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s",fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01382     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01383   }
01384 
01385 
01386   fc_printfLogMessage("get subset shapes");
01387   
01388   // setup and more checking
01389   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo (in_subset, &numMem, &junk,&assoc);
01390   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01391     return rc;
01392 
01393   if (assoc != FC_AT_ELEMENT && assoc != FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH){
01394     fc_printfErrorMessage("subset must have assoc FC_AT_ELEMENT or FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH");
01395     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01396   }
01397 
01398   if (numMem == 0){ //return if empty subset
01399     *numShapes = 0;
01400     return FC_SUCCESS;
01401   }
01402 
01403 
01404   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(in_subset, &mesh);
01405   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01406     return rc;
01407 
01408   //let's get all the info we need about the skin
01409   rc = _fc_buildFaceInfoListFromSubset(in_subset,&faceinfo_list);
01410   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01411     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant build face info list\n");
01412     return rc;
01413   }
01414 
01415   rc = fc_getSubsetName(in_subset,&subsetName);
01416   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01417     _fc_freeSFI_Array(&faceinfo_list);
01418     free(subsetName);
01419     return rc;
01420   }
01421 
01422   rc = _fc_createShapePartsFromFaceInfoList(mesh, &faceinfo_list,&subsetName,
01423                                             comp_angle,shared_dim,&numSides,
01424                                             &newFaceSubsets,&newElemSubsets,
01425                              &adjmatrix);
01426   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01427     free(subsetName);
01428     _fc_freeSFI_Array(&faceinfo_list); //see note about
01429     //deciding how to handle the freeing of this
01430   }
01431 
01432 
01433   rc = fc_segmentAdjacencyMatrix(numSides,adjmatrix,
01434                      &numParts, &sidesPerPart, &partSideIDS);
01435   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01436     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't segment adj matrix sides");
01437     free(subsetName);
01438     return rc;
01439   }
01440 
01441   lshapes = (FC_Shape*)malloc(numParts*sizeof(FC_Shape));
01442   if (lshapes == NULL){
01443     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01444     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01445   }
01446 
01447   for(i = 0; i < numParts; i++){
01448     lshapes[i].numSides = sidesPerPart[i];
01449     lshapes[i].faces = (FC_Subset*)malloc(sidesPerPart[i]*sizeof(FC_Subset));
01450     lshapes[i].elems = (FC_Subset*)malloc(sidesPerPart[i]*sizeof(FC_Subset));
01451     lshapes[i].adjmatrix = (int**)malloc(sidesPerPart[i]*sizeof(int*));
01452     for (j = 0; j < sidesPerPart[i]; j++){
01453       char* temp_name;
01454       temp_name = malloc((strlen(subsetName)+40)*sizeof(char));
01455       if (temp_name == NULL) {
01456      fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01457      return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01458       }
01459       snprintf(temp_name, 
01460             strlen(subsetName)+40,
01461             "%s_Shape%d_FaceSurface%d",
01462             subsetName, i,j);
01463       lshapes[i].adjmatrix[j] = (int*)malloc(sidesPerPart[i]*sizeof(int));
01464       lshapes[i].faces[j] = newFaceSubsets[partSideIDS[i][j]];
01465       fc_changeSubsetName(lshapes[i].faces[j],temp_name);
01466       snprintf(temp_name, 
01467             strlen(subsetName)+40,
01468             "%s_Shape%d_ElemSurface%d", 
01469             subsetName,i,j);
01470       lshapes[i].elems[j] = newElemSubsets[partSideIDS[i][j]];
01471       fc_changeSubsetName(lshapes[i].elems[j],temp_name);
01472       free(temp_name);
01473       for (k = 0; k < sidesPerPart[i]; k++){
01474      lshapes[i].adjmatrix[j][k] = adjmatrix[partSideIDS[i][j]][partSideIDS[i][k]];
01475       }
01476     }
01477   }
01478 
01479 
01480   free(subsetName);
01481   for (i = 0; i < numSides; i++){
01482     free(adjmatrix[i]);
01483   }
01484   free(adjmatrix);
01485   free(newFaceSubsets); //just the array
01486   free(newElemSubsets); //just the array
01487 
01488   for (i = 0 ; i <numParts; i++){
01489     free(partSideIDS[i]);
01490   }
01491   free(partSideIDS);
01492   free(sidesPerPart);
01493 
01494   *numShapes = numParts;
01495   *shapes = lshapes;
01496   
01497   return FC_SUCCESS;
01498 }
01499 
01500 
01501 /**
01502  * \ingroup Shape
01503  * \brief given a mesh, returns an array of FC_Shapes
01504  *
01505  * \description 
01506  *
01507  *  given a mesh, returns an array of \ref FC_Shape. This is the
01508  *  mesh version of \ref fc_getSubsetShapes. See notes there.
01509  *
01510  * \modifications
01511  * - 6/04/06 ACG created
01512  * - 7/16/06 ACG removed "skin" in name
01513  *
01514  */
01515 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshShapes(
01516   FC_Mesh mesh,         /**< input - mesh */
01517   double comp_angle,           /**< input - if two neighboring faces
01518                                 differ by more than this angle then
01519                                 they are considered to be on 
01520                                 different surfaces.*/
01521   int shared_dim,              /**< input - the minimum dimensionality of shared 
01522                                 part of neighbors of faces */
01523   int *numShapes,               /**< output - number of shapes */
01524   FC_Shape **shapes        /**< output shapes array */
01525 ){
01526   
01527   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01528   FC_Subset temp_subset;
01529   char *meshname;
01530 
01531   //---default return values
01532   if (numShapes)
01533     *numShapes = -1;
01534   if (shapes)
01535     *shapes = NULL;
01536 
01537   //check input - some checked in sides
01538   if(!numShapes || !shapes){
01539     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s",fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01540     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01541   }
01542 
01543   // log message
01544   fc_printfLogMessage("getting mesh shapes");
01545 
01546   //does all error checking except is mesh valid inside _fc_getSubsetShapes
01547   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh)){
01548     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01549     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01550   }
01551 
01552   // create a temp subset which is the whole mesh & call fc_getSubsetShapes
01553   rc = fc_getMeshName(mesh,&meshname);
01554   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
01555     return rc;
01556 
01557   rc = fc_createSubset(mesh, meshname, FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &temp_subset);
01558   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01559      fc_deleteSubset(temp_subset);
01560      free(meshname);
01561      return rc;
01562   }
01563   free(meshname);
01564 
01565   rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(temp_subset, 0);
01566   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01567      fc_deleteSubset(temp_subset);
01568      return rc;
01569   }
01570 
01571    // do it
01572   rc = fc_getSubsetShapes(temp_subset, comp_angle,shared_dim,numShapes,
01573                      shapes);
01574   fc_deleteSubset(temp_subset);
01575   return rc;
01576 }
01577 
01578 
01579 /**
01580  * \ingroup Shape
01581  * \brief given a shape and a new angle, creates a new shape
01582  *        where the sides are distinguished byt he new angle
01583  *
01584  * \description 
01585  *
01586  *        given a shape and a new angle, creates a new shape
01587  *        where the sides are distinguished by the new angle.
01588  *        The shared dim is used to determine neighbors for comparison
01589  *        when you build the sides, but since you are limited
01590  *        only to those sides that are in the orginal shape, you should
01591  *        keep this to the orignal number used. (I have no way of checking that)
01592  *
01593  *        This function is intended to be used 1) when you get too
01594  *        few sides or 2) if you have too many sides, as an alternate
01595  *        crtieria for merging sides than \ref fc_reduceShapeNumSides uses.
01596  *
01597  *        The face and elem subsets will be named "Reshape"
01598  *        postpended with  "Shape#" followed by
01599  *        "_FaceSurface#" or "_ElemSurface#" where # will be the index into the
01600  *        array of subsets for that shape.
01601  *
01602  * \todo
01603  *  - check if segdim is a problem or not
01604  *  - better new shape name
01605  *       
01606  * \modifications     
01607  *  - 08/19/06 ACG creating
01608  */
01609 FC_ReturnCode fc_reshapeByAngle(
01610  FC_Shape *inshape, /**< input - orig shape */
01611  double newangle, /**< input - new angle used for the reshaping */
01612  int seg_dim, /**< input - seg dim, should be that used for building the orig shape */
01613  FC_Shape *newshape /**< output - the new shape */
01614 ){
01615 
01616   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01617   FC_Mesh mesh;
01618 
01619   _FC_SFI_ARRAY faceinfo_list;
01620   int numSides;
01621   FC_Subset* newFaceSubsets;
01622   FC_Subset* newElemSubsets;
01623   int **adjmatrix;
01624   char* newname = "Reshape";
01625 
01626   // default return - freeing shape is not an option
01627   if (newshape){
01628     fc_initShape(newshape);
01629   }
01630 
01631 
01632   if (!inshape || !newshape || newangle < 0 ||
01633       newangle > 180 || seg_dim < 0 || seg_dim > 2 || 
01634       !(inshape->numSides)){
01635     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01636     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01637   }
01638 
01639   //log message
01640   fc_printfLogMessage("reshape by angle");
01641 
01642   //assume that since we have a shape already, the topology etc is correct.
01643   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(inshape->faces[0],&mesh);
01644   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01645     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh for shape");
01646     return rc;
01647   }
01648 
01649   rc = _fc_buildFaceInfoListFromShape(inshape,&faceinfo_list);
01650   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01651     fc_printfErrorMessage("can't build face info list\n");
01652     return rc;
01653   }
01654 
01655   rc = _fc_createShapePartsFromFaceInfoList(mesh,&faceinfo_list,
01656                              &newname,newangle,
01657                              seg_dim,
01658                              &numSides,
01659                              &newFaceSubsets,
01660                              &newElemSubsets,
01661                              &adjmatrix);
01662   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01663     fc_printfErrorMessage("can't create shape parts from face info list\n");
01664     _fc_freeSFI_Array(&faceinfo_list);
01665     return rc;
01666   }
01667 
01668   //unlike subsetshapes we want to return this as one shape
01669   newshape->numSides = numSides;
01670   newshape->faces = newFaceSubsets;
01671   newshape->elems = newElemSubsets;
01672   newshape->adjmatrix = adjmatrix; 
01673 
01674   //dont free anything since theyve been assigned to the shape
01675   return FC_SUCCESS;
01676 }
01677 
01678 
01679 
01680 /**
01681  * \ingroup Shape
01682  * \brief given a shape and a desired number of sides, fewer
01683  *        than the current number of sides, creates a new shape
01684  *        with the desired number of sides
01685  *
01686  * \description 
01687  *
01688  *        Given a shape and a desired number of sides, fewer
01689  *        than the current number of sides, creates a new shape
01690  *        with the desired number of sides. This function is 
01691  *        intended to be used to merge small, perhaps curved
01692  *        faces into a major side. For instance, if on a
01693  *        rectangular prism with curved edges you set the
01694  *        angle to determine the division between edges as
01695  *        large, then it may resolve into one continuous side;
01696  *        on the other hand, if you set it to small, then all 
01697  *        faces along the curve may resolve into distinct sides.
01698  *        If you instead know that you want to end with 6 sides,
01699  *        then call shape with a small angle, resulting in too many
01700  *        sides, and then call this function to reduce the shape 
01701  *        to a 6 sided shape, retaining the 6 largest sides.
01702  *
01703  *        The innards iterate assigning each reduced out
01704  *        side to an arbitrary side of distance 1 as given 
01705  *        by the adj matrix. The reducedout faces therefore arent
01706  *        elegantly distributed into the new sides, and you
01707  *        may end up with odd adjacency matricies as a result.
01708  *
01709  *        The kept sides retain their same names and ordering.
01710  *
01711  *        See \ref fc_reshapeByAngle
01712  *
01713  * \todo
01714  *  - avoid the shape copy at the end
01715  *  - intent is to later have another function that class this one that
01716  *    does the shape call and somehow decides what the ideal
01717  *    number and IDs of sides is. this could be done for basic shapes
01718  *    if there is a great discrepancy in the areas of the resulting
01719  *    sides - e.g., 6 large sides and a zillion small ones
01720  *       
01721  * \modifications     
01722  * - 08/09/06 ACG creating
01723  * - 09/27/06 ACG changing algorithm
01724  */
01725 FC_ReturnCode fc_reduceShapeNumSides(
01726   FC_Shape *inshape, /**< input - shape to be reduced */
01727   int reducedNumSides, /**< input - number of sides to be in reduced shape */
01728   FC_Shape *reducedshape /**< output - the reduced shape */
01729   ){
01730 
01731   FC_ReturnCode rc, rc1, rc2;
01732   FC_Mesh mesh;
01733   int **distmatrix;
01734 
01735   //dont need to be sorted, just taking advantage of the selfexpansion
01736   FC_SortedIntArray *combosides, *newlyassignedsides;
01737   FC_SortedIntArray remainingsides;
01738   FC_Shape newshape;
01739   int i,j,k,l;
01740 
01741   //defaults
01742   if (reducedshape){
01743     fc_initShape(reducedshape);
01744   }
01745 
01746   if (!inshape || reducedNumSides < 1 || 
01747       reducedNumSides >= inshape->numSides ||
01748       !reducedshape){
01749     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01750     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01751   }
01752 
01753   //log message
01754   fc_printfLogMessage("reduceShapeNumSides");
01755 
01756   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(inshape->faces[0],&mesh);
01757   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01758     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cant get mesh from subset");
01759     return rc;
01760   }
01761 
01762   //first copy the sides that we are keeping over
01763   combosides = (FC_SortedIntArray*)malloc(reducedNumSides*
01764                            sizeof(FC_SortedIntArray));
01765   newlyassignedsides = (FC_SortedIntArray*)malloc(reducedNumSides*
01766                            sizeof(FC_SortedIntArray));
01767   if (!combosides || ! newlyassignedsides){
01768     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01769     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01770   }
01771 
01772   for (i = 0; i < reducedNumSides; i++){
01773     rc1 = fc_initSortedIntArray(&combosides[i]);
01774     rc2 = fc_initSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[i]);
01775     if (rc1 !=FC_SUCCESS || rc2 != FC_SUCCESS){
01776       fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't init SIA");
01777       for (j = 0; j < i; j++){
01778      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
01779      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j]);
01780       }
01781       free(combosides);
01782       free(newlyassignedsides);
01783       return (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS ? rc1 : rc2);
01784     }
01785     rc = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&combosides[i],i);
01786     if (rc < 0){
01787       fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't add int to SIA");
01788       for (j = 0; j < i; j++){
01789      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
01790      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j]);
01791       }
01792       free(combosides);
01793       free(newlyassignedsides);
01794       return rc;
01795     }
01796   }
01797 
01798   //get ids for left over faces
01799   rc = fc_initSortedIntArray(&remainingsides);
01800   if (rc !=FC_SUCCESS){
01801     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cant init sia");
01802     for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
01803       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);   
01804       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j]);
01805     }
01806     free(combosides);
01807     free(newlyassignedsides);
01808     return rc;
01809   }
01810 
01811   for (i = reducedNumSides; i < inshape->numSides; i++){
01812     rc = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&remainingsides,i);
01813     if (rc < 0){
01814       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant add int to SIA");
01815       for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
01816      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
01817      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j]);
01818       }
01819       free(combosides);
01820       free(newlyassignedsides);
01821       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&remainingsides);
01822       return rc;
01823     }
01824   }
01825 
01826   rc = fc_calcDistanceMatrix(inshape->numSides, inshape->adjmatrix,
01827                     &distmatrix);
01828   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01829     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get dist matrix");
01830     for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
01831       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
01832       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j]);
01833     }
01834     free(combosides);
01835     free(newlyassignedsides);
01836     fc_freeSortedIntArray(&remainingsides);
01837     return rc;
01838   }
01839 
01840   while(remainingsides.numVal){
01841     int assigned = 0;
01842     
01843     //find all sides that are distance 1 from one ofthe established sides
01844     //only update the established sides after each pass
01845     for (i = 0; i < remainingsides.numVal; i++){
01846       int foundside = 0;
01847       int comboid;
01848       int currside = remainingsides.vals[i];
01849       for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
01850      for (k = 0; k < combosides[j].numVal; k++){
01851        int compside = combosides[j].vals[k];
01852        comboid = j;
01853        if (distmatrix[currside][compside] ==1){
01854          foundside = 1;
01855          break;
01856        }
01857      }
01858      if (foundside)
01859        break;
01860       }
01861       if (foundside){
01862      rc1 = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j],currside);
01863      rc2 = fc_deleteIntFromSortedIntArray(&remainingsides,currside);
01864      if (rc1 < 0 || rc2 < 0){
01865        fc_printfErrorMessage("cant add/delete int to/from SIA");
01866        for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
01867          fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
01868          fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j]);
01869        }
01870        free(combosides);
01871        free(newlyassignedsides);
01872        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&remainingsides);
01873        for (j = 0; j < inshape->numSides; j++){
01874          free(distmatrix[j]);
01875        }
01876        free(distmatrix);
01877        return (rc1 < 0 ? rc1 : rc2);
01878      }
01879      assigned++;
01880       }
01881     }
01882     
01883     if (!assigned){
01884       fc_printfErrorMessage("None of the remaining sides are distance 1 from any of the current sides");
01885       for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
01886      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
01887      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j]);
01888       }
01889       free(combosides);
01890       free(newlyassignedsides);
01891       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&remainingsides);
01892       for (j = 0; j < inshape->numSides; j++){
01893      free(distmatrix[j]);
01894       }
01895       free(distmatrix);
01896       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01897     }
01898 
01899     //copy the newly assigned sides into the established sides
01900     for (i = 0; i < reducedNumSides; i++){
01901       for (j = 0; j < newlyassignedsides[i].numVal; j++){
01902      rc = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&combosides[i],newlyassignedsides[i].vals[j]);
01903      if (rc < 0){
01904        fc_printfErrorMessage("cant add int to SIA");
01905        for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
01906          fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
01907          fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[j]);
01908        }
01909        free(combosides);
01910        free(newlyassignedsides);
01911        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&remainingsides);
01912        for (j = 0; j < inshape->numSides; j++){
01913          free(distmatrix[j]);
01914        }
01915        free(distmatrix);
01916        return rc;
01917      }
01918       }
01919       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&newlyassignedsides[i]);
01920     }
01921   } //while
01922 
01923   //clean up some things
01924   for (j = 0; j < inshape->numSides; j++){
01925     free(distmatrix[j]);
01926   }
01927   free(distmatrix);
01928   free(newlyassignedsides); //individual ones already freed
01929   fc_freeSortedIntArray(&remainingsides);
01930 
01931   //now build the new shape
01932   newshape.numSides = reducedNumSides;
01933   newshape.faces = (FC_Subset*)malloc(reducedNumSides*sizeof(FC_Subset));
01934   newshape.elems = (FC_Subset*)malloc(reducedNumSides*sizeof(FC_Subset));
01935   newshape.adjmatrix = (int**)malloc(reducedNumSides*sizeof(int*));
01936   if (!newshape.faces || !newshape.elems || !newshape.adjmatrix){
01937     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01938     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01939   }
01940 
01941   for (i = 0; i < reducedNumSides; i++){
01942     //allocate them all now so can use free shape as a set later
01943     newshape.adjmatrix[i] = (int*)malloc(reducedNumSides*sizeof(int));
01944     if (!newshape.adjmatrix[i]){
01945       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01946       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01947     }
01948     for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
01949       newshape.adjmatrix[i][j] = 0;
01950     }
01951   }
01952 
01953   for (i = 0; i < reducedNumSides; i++){
01954     int nume, numf;
01955     int *arrf, *arre;
01956     char *temp;
01957 
01958     //assign the first item in each combo side to the new side
01959     rc1 = fc_copySubset(inshape->faces[combosides[i].vals[0]],mesh,
01960                "temp",&(newshape.faces[i]));
01961     rc2 = fc_copySubset(inshape->elems[combosides[i].vals[0]],mesh,
01962                "temp",&(newshape.elems[i]));
01963     if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS || rc2 != FC_SUCCESS){
01964       fc_printfErrorMessage("Cant copy subsets");
01965       for (j = 0; j <= i; j++){
01966      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
01967       }
01968       free(combosides);
01969       fc_freeShape(&newshape);
01970       return (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS ? rc1:rc2);
01971     }
01972     
01973     //rename them to what they were in that original position
01974     //if cant rename, just warn
01975     rc = fc_getSubsetName(inshape->faces[i],&temp);
01976     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS || temp == NULL){
01977       fc_printfWarningMessage("fc_reduceShapeNumSides can't get name for face side %d", i);
01978     }else{
01979       rc = fc_changeSubsetName(newshape.faces[i],temp);
01980       if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
01981      fc_printfWarningMessage("fc_reduceShapeNumSides can't rename face side %d", i);
01982       }
01983     }
01984     if (temp) free(temp);
01985        
01986     rc = fc_getSubsetName(inshape->elems[i],&temp);
01987     if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS || temp == NULL){
01988       fc_printfWarningMessage("fc_reduceShapeNumSides can't get name for elem side %d", i);
01989     }else{
01990       rc = fc_changeSubsetName(newshape.elems[i],temp);
01991       if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
01992      fc_printfWarningMessage("fc_reduceShapeNumSides can't rename elem side %d", i);
01993       }
01994     }
01995     if (temp) free(temp);
01996 
01997     //now copy all other members over
01998     for (j = 1; j < combosides[i].numVal; j++){
01999       int currside = combosides[i].vals[j];
02000       rc1 = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(inshape->faces[currside],
02001                            &numf,&arrf);
02002       rc2 = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(inshape->elems[currside],
02003                            &nume,&arre);
02004       if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS || rc2 != FC_SUCCESS){
02005      fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get subset members");
02006      for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
02007        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
02008      }
02009      free(combosides);
02010      fc_freeShape(&newshape);
02011      if (arrf) free (arrf);
02012      if (arre) free (arre);
02013      return (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS ? rc1 : rc2);
02014       }
02015 
02016       //make sure wont fail if add duplicates
02017       rc1 = fc_addArrayMembersToSubset(newshape.faces[i],
02018                            numf,arrf);
02019       rc1 = fc_addArrayMembersToSubset(newshape.elems[i],
02020                            nume,arre);
02021       free(arrf);
02022       free(arre);
02023       if (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS || rc2 != FC_SUCCESS){
02024      fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't add subset members");
02025      for (j = 0; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
02026        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[j]);
02027      }
02028      free(combosides);
02029      fc_freeShape(&newshape);
02030      return (rc1 != FC_SUCCESS ? rc1 : rc2);
02031       }
02032     } //combosides.numVal
02033   } // reducedNumSides
02034 
02035 
02036   //now all the sides have been assigned and the faces and the elems put in
02037   //the adj matrix is all zeros at this point
02038   for (i = 0; i < reducedNumSides; i++){
02039     for (j = i+1; j < reducedNumSides; j++){
02040       if (inshape->adjmatrix[i][j]){
02041      //if they were adj before, they still are
02042      newshape.adjmatrix[i][j] = 1;
02043      newshape.adjmatrix[j][i] = 1;
02044       }else{
02045      //they may now be adj becuase of the reducing
02046      for (k = 0; k < combosides[i].numVal; k++){
02047        for (l = 0; l < combosides[j].numVal; l++){
02048          int sideA = combosides[i].vals[k];
02049          int sideB = combosides[j].vals[l];
02050          if (inshape->adjmatrix[sideA][sideB]){
02051            newshape.adjmatrix[i][j] = 1;
02052            newshape.adjmatrix[j][i] = 1;
02053            break;
02054          }
02055        }
02056        if (newshape.adjmatrix[i][j]){
02057          //we found a match inside
02058          break;
02059        }
02060      }
02061       }
02062     }
02063   }
02064 
02065   //cleanup
02066   for (i = 0; i < reducedNumSides; i++){
02067     fc_freeSortedIntArray(&combosides[i]);
02068   }
02069   free(combosides);
02070 
02071   //handle this shape better
02072   rc = fc_copyShape(&newshape,reducedshape);
02073   fc_freeShape(&newshape);
02074 
02075   return FC_SUCCESS;
02076 }
02077 
02078 
02079 //@}
02080 
02081 
02082 /** \name Shape Helpers */
02083 //-------------------------------
02084 //@{
02085 
02086 /**
02087  * \ingroup Shape
02088  * \brief Copy a shape.
02089  *
02090  * \description
02091  *
02092  *    This is a deep copy; it allocates memory and the created shape will need
02093  *    to be freed by the caller.
02094  *
02095  * \modifications
02096  *  - 06/18/06 ACG created
02097  */
02098 FC_ReturnCode fc_copyShape(
02099   FC_Shape *inshape, /**< input - ptr to shape */
02100   FC_Shape *outshape /**< output - ptr to the shape */
02101 ){
02102 
02103   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02104   FC_Shape shape;
02105   int i,j;
02106 
02107   //defaults
02108   if (outshape){
02109     fc_initShape(outshape);
02110   }
02111 
02112 
02113   if (!inshape || !outshape ){
02114     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02115     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02116   }
02117 
02118   // log message
02119   fc_printfLogMessage("copying shape");
02120 
02121   shape.numSides = inshape->numSides;
02122   shape.faces = (FC_Subset*)malloc(shape.numSides*sizeof(FC_Subset));
02123   shape.elems = (FC_Subset*)malloc(shape.numSides*sizeof(FC_Subset));
02124   shape.adjmatrix = (int**)malloc(shape.numSides*sizeof(int*));
02125   if (!shape.faces || ! shape.elems || ! shape.adjmatrix){
02126     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02127     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02128   }
02129   for (i = 0; i < shape.numSides; i++){
02130     FC_Mesh mesh; //these really should all be onthe same mesh
02131     char* subname;
02132 
02133     rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(inshape->faces[i],&mesh);
02134     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
02135       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh from subset");
02136       fc_freeShape(&shape);
02137       return rc;
02138     }
02139     rc = fc_getSubsetName(inshape->faces[i],&subname);
02140     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
02141       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get name of subset");
02142       fc_freeShape(&shape);
02143       return rc;
02144     }
02145     //is it ok to use the same name ?
02146     rc =  fc_copySubset(inshape->faces[i],mesh,subname,&(shape.faces[i]));
02147     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
02148       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant copy subset");
02149       fc_freeShape(&shape);
02150       return rc;
02151     }
02152     free(subname);
02153 
02154     rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(inshape->elems[i],&mesh);
02155     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
02156       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh from subset");
02157       fc_freeShape(&shape);
02158       return rc;
02159     }
02160     rc = fc_getSubsetName(inshape->elems[i],&subname);
02161     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
02162       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get name of subset");
02163       fc_freeShape(&shape);
02164       return rc;
02165     }
02166     //is it ok to use the same name ?
02167     rc =  fc_copySubset(inshape->elems[i],mesh,subname,&(shape.elems[i]));
02168     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
02169       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant copy subset");
02170       fc_freeShape(&shape);
02171       return rc;
02172     }
02173     
02174     free(subname);
02175 
02176     shape.adjmatrix[i] = (int*)malloc(shape.numSides*sizeof(int));
02177     if (!shape.adjmatrix[i]){
02178       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02179       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02180     }
02181   }
02182     
02183   for (i = 0; i < shape.numSides; i++){
02184     for (j = 0; j < shape.numSides; j++){
02185       shape.adjmatrix[i][j] = inshape->adjmatrix[i][j];
02186     }
02187   }
02188 
02189   outshape->numSides = shape.numSides;
02190   outshape->faces = shape.faces;
02191   outshape->elems = shape.elems;
02192   outshape->adjmatrix = shape.adjmatrix;
02193 
02194   return FC_SUCCESS;
02195 }
02196 
02197 
02198 /**
02199  * \ingroup Shape
02200  * \brief given a new ordering of the sides, reorders a shape 
02201  *
02202  * \description
02203  *
02204  *  Given a new ordering of the sides, reorders a shape.
02205  *  Example: given the orig sides (set0,set1,set2,set3,set4) with
02206  *  new order = (2,4,1,0,3) then the sides will be
02207  *  reordered to (set2,set4,set1,set0,set3). That is
02208  *  what was in place 2 has been moved to place 0, as
02209  *  opposed to moving what was in place 0 to place 2.
02210  *
02211  *  This keeps the original names of the subsets to allow
02212  *  referring to subsets by name to still be consistent. If you
02213  *  want to reorder the names, you must do so manually.
02214  *
02215  * \modifications
02216  *  - 06/18/06 ACG created
02217  *  - 06/19/06 ACG changed reorder so the indicies
02218  *    are now what the new order is going to be, rather
02219  *    than where the old order is moving to, because
02220  *    its more intuitive that way.
02221  */
02222 FC_ReturnCode fc_reorderShape(
02223   int *neworder, /**< input - array of new order of indicies */
02224   FC_Shape *shape /**< output - ptr to the shape */
02225 ){
02226 
02227   FC_Subset *temp, *temp2; 
02228   int numSides;
02229   int** adjmatrix;
02230   int i,j;
02231 
02232   //no defaults
02233 
02234   if (!shape || !neworder){
02235     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
